behind.translation[0].definitions[0].def: at or towards the back of a thing or person
behind.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.
Someone could easily creep up behind us.
The car behind was hooting impatiently.
Jane shut the door behind her.
The manager was sitting behind a large desk.
He set off down the road with the rest of us following close behind.
behind.translation[0].definitions[1].def: not as successful or not having made as much progress as someone or something else
behind.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Mark’s always behind the rest of his class in mathematics.
This victory lifts Ferguson’s team into fifth place, nine points behind leaders Norwich.
Europe was falling behind in the important field of computer technology.
behind.translation[0].definitions[2].def: used to say that someone is late in doing what they have to do
behind.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: This work should have been finished yesterday. I’m getting terribly behind.
Victor had fallen behind with his mortgage payments after losing his job.
an important research project that is already two years behind schedule (=not ready at the time planned)
behind.translation[0].definitions[3].def: used for talking about the hidden reason for something
behind.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: I wonder what’s behind this change of plan.
Perhaps a bitter experience lay behind her anger.
behind.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The workers are very much behind these proposals.
I suppose I’m lucky because my parents were behind me all the way.
behind.translation[0].definitions[5].def: responsible for a plan, idea etc or for organizing something
behind.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: It was alleged that foreign agents were behind the recent violence.
The Rotary Club is behind the fund-raising for the new hospital.
behind.translation[0].definitions[6].def: if an unpleasant experience or situation is behind you, it no longer upsets you or affects your life
behind.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: Now you can put all these worries behind you.
a chance to start a new life and leave all your troubles behind
behind.translation[0].definitions[7].def: if you have experience behind you, you have gained valuable skills or important qualities that can be used
behind.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: Marjorie is one of the top designers in the business, with years of experience behind her.
behind.translation[0].definitions[8].def: used when the real facts about a situation or someone’s character are hidden by the way things seem or by the way a person behaves
behind.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: We were determined to find the truth behind this mystery.
You could see the burning hatred behind Graham’s calm manner.
behind.translation[0].definitions[9].def: if a student stays behind after school or after a lesson, they stay after it has finished
behind.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: at or towards the back of something, and often hidden by it
The sun went behind a cloud.
I got stuck behind a truck on the way to the airport.
There’s a small garden at the back of the cottage.
Their house has a pool in the back.
behind something, especially a building. At/to the rear sounds rather formal and is used especially in written descriptions
They parked in a small car park at the rear of the hotel.
There is a small seating area to the rear.
if someone or something is in the background, it is behind the place where the main activity is happening
If you look carefully at the painting, you will see several men sitting at a table in the background.
behind.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to be late making a regular payment or doing work
behind.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Over 4% of British borrowers are likely to be a month or more behind with their repayments.
You may be putting your tenancy at risk if you fall behind with the rent.
I can’t sleep at night because I’m worried about getting behind with my work.
behind.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to support a person, an idea, or the work they are doing
behind.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Cabinet Ministers rallied behind the Prime Minister yesterday.
behind.translation[3].definitions[1].def: not as advanced or successful as someone or something else
behind.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: Their social and economic development is so far behind the rest of the world that they can never compete on equal terms.
behind.translation[3].definitions[2].def: not arriving or happening at the right time
behind.translation[3].definitions[2].exa: Commuters were delayed for up to 35 minutes as trains ran behind schedule.
Contractors who fall behind schedule will incur financial penalties.
